Package io.crums.sldg

Class Row

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.Row
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.crums.util.hash.Digest
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaggedRow, SerialRow
public abstract class Row
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.crums.util.hash.Digest
A row in a ledger. Instances have immutable state.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • rowNumber

      public abstract long rowNumber()
      Returns the row number.
      Returns:
      ≥ 1
      See Also:
      equals(Object)

    • inputHash

      public abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer inputHash()
      Returns the user-inputed hash. This is the hash of the abstract object (whatever it is, we don't know).
      Returns:
      non-null, Digest.hashWidth() bytes remaining

    • data

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer data()
      Returns the byte string used to compute the hash of this row. This contains 1 + skipCount(rowNumber()) many hash cells, each cell Digest.hashWidth() many bytes wide.

      Note this has nothing to do with how an instance is serialized for storage or over-the-wire; it's about what data contributes a row's hash.

      Returns:
      may be read-only

    • hash

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer hash()
      Returns the hash of this row.
      Returns:
      may be read-only, Digest.hashWidth() bytes remaining
      See Also:
      data()

    • hash

      public final java.nio.ByteBuffer hash​(long rowNumber)
      Returns the hash of the given row number. An instance knows the hash of not just itself, but also of the rows it references thru its skip pointers.
      See Also:
      coveredRowNumbers()

    • coveredRowNumbers

      public final java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.Long> coveredRowNumbers()
      Returns the set of row numbers covered by this row. This includes the row's own row number, as well as those referenced thru its hash pointers. The hashes of these referenced rows is available thru the hash(long) method.

    • prevHash

      public abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer prevHash​(int level)
      Returns the hash of the row referenced at the given level.
      Parameters:
      level - ≥ 0 and < prevLevels()
      Returns:
      non-null, Digest.hashWidth() bytes wide

    • prevLevels

      public final int prevLevels()
      Returns the number of hash pointers in this row referencing previous rows. These are called levels, because each successive previous hash points to a row numbered twice as far away as the level before it.
      Returns:
      ≥ 1

    • prevRowNumber

      public final long prevRowNumber​(int level)
      Returns the row number linked to at the given level.
      Parameters:
      level - ≥ 0 and < prevLevels()
      Returns:
      rowNumber() - (1L << level)
      See Also:
      hash(long)

    • equals

      public final boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Equality semantics depend on hash, and row number.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      See Also:
      hashCode()

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Consistent with equals(Object). Implemented for the Java Collections classes.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
